comments.body: It would also greatly help people that just want to make their own custom structures in their world. Imagin creating something and then uploading it to a random world and just naturally finding it. The feeling would be great
It's been many years and this still hasn't been updated

There's a mcpe addon that can be used as a workaround, though it uses structure blocks instead of jigsaw blocks. It's called Import and Export Button For Structure Blocks.It allows you to directly download a mcstructure file into a user set folder and then import it into whatever world you want. It's just a resource pack so it can be set as your global resource pack and automatically used on any world without enabling it in the resource pack menu. This is the link to the addon for those who are interested. https://mcpedl.com/structure-block-import-and-export-button/

Amazing idea! I think Minecraft needs a villager structure just under the level of villages! This would show the first stages of village building. Great idea to have wandering traders stay in and become normal traders. Here are some other details that could really bring this idea to life:

More tents with beds or larger tents to house furnaces, crafting tables, etc.

A central meeting place, maybe on an open area.

Upright wooden log wall around the central tents, with a few house-like tents outside of the wall.

Maybe a new type of villager like a lumberjack or carpenter to assist in building the camp?

I would like to fly to the moon too! How about this-;-)

When you reach the flight limit (not the build height), if it is night time you should hit the moon which is made out of endstone and you can have infinite jump boost while on the moon and jump off the side to get back down to earth (heads up to Grian!)

On the moon you can find moon ore which is very hard and you can only break it with an enchanted diamond pickaxe (efficiency 3) and when obtained and smelted it becomes unbreakable.

Moondust collected from the floor can be brewed with potions of slow falling to make levitation potions so you can float around on the moon and overworld.

If it is day time when you reach the flight limit you will hit lava or the sun.

How about some logs are written in a coherent language, depending upon the translation of the game, and then there could be other logs that are in a villager language (humming and grunting) and another type could be in the odd enchantment table language. This would allow for more, varied lore aspects for various worlds and it could signify what type of loot is found within the sunken ship; example: sunken ships with coherent logs could have maps and paper, sunken ships with villager language could have ores like emeralds and iron nuggets, and sunken ships with the enchantment table language could have enchanted books/armor and lapis.

Just a thought, love the captain's log idea!

I love the idea, but believe they should be rare.  Generally, it would generate instead as leather and 1-3 paper.  Sometimes, it would be a book.  Sometimes, the book would have illegible or unicode writing, which may have some form of relevance, though maybe not.  Once in a while, you may find partial written books.  There should be variants, or randomly generated pages that may or may not appear.  It should take several worlds to complete a set.   I say this because it shouldn't just be the same thing written over and over again, because that would get boring fast.

I agree with that, the game is too repetitive. You could expand on this with new rarer caves, the further you go. Or make caves deeper, and more dangerous with new mobs the deeper you go.

I believe this should be expanded upon like how RenegadeRobin99 said. Having more detailed versions of already existing structures (like caves, or other things) would be a good way to tempt people to travel out. At the same time, I think this would need stages/levels of progression. That way, you couldn't just get an elytra and fly 50k blocks in an hour and call it good for the rest of the game. It would be nice if each distance would also have an increase in difficulty of some kind (like maybe certain mobs, or mob spawn rates, or certain biome generation patterns)

Level 1: 0 - 1,000

Level 2: 1,000 - 10,000

Level 3: 10,000 - 100,000

Level 4: 100,00 +

I think this would work best if difficulty was a value selected only at world generation. That way, you could have different distances for each segmented level based on difficulty, and it would allow for players who are actually willing to go beyond normal skill levels, have more depth to it.

Love the Hot Springs idea! We definitely need more lake variants.

Each of these should be their own post, as they're three very different ideas.  I like the idea of replacing gravel in the abandoned mineshaft ceiling with planks, as that would absolutely be something the miners would have shored up.  What are these skulls?  Are they existing mob heads (eg. skeleton) or are they new items?  If they are new items, do they have any purpose other than decoration?

I don't particularly see a need for even more Stronghold rooms.  I also don't necessarily see the connection between there being a library and the stronghold being a habitation.  Libraries can be personal, but they can also be curated for a wider audience, either general or select.  In fact, libraries as large as are found in the strongholds are more likely to not be private libraries.  A higher endermen spawn rate is interesting.

You should be able to keep hot spring water hot if you move it to a new place.  Maybe lava within three blocks of a source block of hot spring water keeps that water hot or heat up cooled water.

 

(If this is at all based on my big Mythos series, all of the suggestions there were in the context of the new dimension suggestion and are very much interdependent.  Many of the suggestions are there as ideas to flesh out the general dimension suggestion as much as concrete sugestions in their own right.  These ideas are for the existing dimensions and most seem to be generally related at best.  Some do seem to be connected but ended up in different posts because of the sectioned nature of the site.  They should probably at least be divided up by the categories you already made.  I know it's hard to know where to break things up.)

I like the ideas of replacing gravel with wood (possibly with a support made from cobblestone walls), having Enderman spawn more frequently in strongholds, and a bedroom for the strongholds.  The skulls and silverfish seem a little unnecessary.
Interesting idea with hot springs and skulls along with increasing enderman spawn rate, would be helpful for farming.
